title: Stirling's Men: The Inside History of the SAS in World War II
description: This riveting history of the formation of Britainâ€™s Special Air Services (SAS)and its activities through the last battles of World War IIreads like a novel. Written by a distinguished war journalist, it is the first account of the SAS officially sanctioned by the veterans and based on their unique first-hand testimony. More than 60 men who were there at the start provided personal documents on founder David Stirling and the organization he turned into the stuff of legend.
author: Gavin Mortimer
